channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: The Brutalism Post, Part One: Introduction
item.description: A prospectus for some posts on Brutalism, incl. some good takes on what it means for architecture to be 'good.'

item.title: On The Mueller Report, Vol. 1
item.description: "cA criminal accusation that lost its original referent, except that it concerned emails or hackers and servers."

item.title: The Fleshy Frontier
item.description: Deals mostly with Kristeva's 'abjection,' but dovetailes nicely with Negative Ecstasies.

item.title: The Real Problem At Yale Is Not Free Speech
item.description: ...it's class-performance, severing advocacy from its cause.

item.title: The Iceberg Secret, Revealed
item.description: It's easy to mistake mocks for something near completion.

item.title: Tsutomu Yamaguchi
item.description: Tracked down for posterity; the nijyuu hibakusha, surviving of the bombings at Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

item.title: How can we develop transformative tools for thought?
item.description: Most interesting: "elements of style" for memory-building puzzles.

item.title: Stick it to Sports
item.description: A debate over the the Timbers Army's antifascism, and the political tradition of soccer clubs.

item.title: Cormac Country
item.description: Mostly fawning, but there are good tidbits of McCarthy's commentary on scientists.

item.title: Then WeCame to the End
item.description: Good n+1 breakdown of WeWork's relationship with venture capital

item.title: A Sea Story
item.description: Harrowing story about panic on the Estonia.
